title: How can I make Firefox run smoother with multiple tabs open?
content:
Lately, I’ve noticed Firefox slowing down quite a bit when I have more than 10 tabs open, especially ones with videos or data-heavy pages. I’ve already tried disabling some extensions and clearing cache, but it still seems to lag. I also came across discussions about managing memory or using lightweight browsing habits — a bit like how people manage their personal finances with tools like [https://sassyfi.com/ sassyfi.com](https://sassyfi.com/) or organize [https://governmentschemes.pk/ government schemes](https://governmentschemes.pk/) info efficiently.

I’m wondering if anyone here has tips or settings tweaks that help Firefox perform better in such cases? Maybe something similar to how you streamline job searches on [jobbuzz.pk](Jobs and career website https://jobbuzz.pk/) or handle digital forms for [[https://personalloan.pk/|https://personalloan.pk/] personal loans](https://personalloan.pk/)? title: HP EliteBook Laptop Security: Why It Stands Out for Professionals
content:
When it comes to business laptops, security is one of the most important factors — and HP has taken that seriously with its EliteBook series. These laptops are built for professionals who handle sensitive data, connect to multiple networks, and can’t afford to compromise on protection.

Let’s look at what makes HP EliteBook Laptops some of the most secure laptops on the market.

1. HP Sure Start – BIOS-Level Protection

The BIOS is the heart of every computer, and HP’s Sure Start feature automatically detects and recovers the system BIOS from attacks or corruption. This means even if malware tries to compromise your BIOS, your EliteBook can restore it to a clean, safe version — without needing IT intervention.

2. HP Sure Sense – AI-Based Threat Detection

HP integrates machine learning into its security system through Sure Sense. It uses AI to recognize and stop malware or ransomware in real-time, including zero-day threats that traditional antivirus programs might miss.

3. HP Sure View – Privacy at a Glance

Ever work in a public space or café? HP’s Sure View feature lets you activate a privacy screen with a single button. It instantly narrows your display’s viewing angle, keeping your screen visible only to you and preventing shoulder-surfing.

4. HP Wolf Security – End-to-End Protection

HP’s latest security suite, Wolf Security, combines hardware, firmware, and software protection. It includes features like:

  1. Isolated browsing to keep online threats contained
  1. Application protection that prevents malware from spreading
  1. Firmware resilience that ensures your system remains secure during startup
  1. This layered approach makes EliteBooks exceptionally hard to compromise.

5. Physical Security Features

HP EliteBooks also come with practical, physical protections such as:

Fingerprint readers and IR cameras for secure biometric logins

TPM 2.0 chips for hardware-based encryption

Lock slots to physically secure your laptop when unattended

6. Regular Security Updates

HP frequently releases firmware and driver updates that patch potential vulnerabilities. Combined with Windows 11 Pro’s built-in security tools, EliteBooks maintain one of the strongest defense systems in the business laptop segment.

Conclusion

The HP EliteBook series isn’t just about premium design or performance — it’s about trust and protection. Whether you’re a remote worker, IT professional, or business executive, these laptops offer a level of security confidence that few competitors match.

If you value your data and want peace of mind, HP’s EliteBook lineup is a solid choice for secure, professional computing.
creator: zunairmajeed

title: c++program
content:
en an if-else construct appear as a statement within another if-block or a else-block, it is referred to as nesting of if-else construct.

Below is an example of a nested if-else construct:

if (expression_1) { if (expression_2) { if (expression_3) { statement_1; } else { statement_2; } } else { statement_3; } }

In the above syntax, the statement_2 will be executed only when the conditions in expression_1 and expression_2 results true and expression_3 evaluates to false.

Click on to understand the working of a nested if-else construct by finding the largest of given three numbers.

Go through the given live demo to familiarize yourself withnested if-else usage and write a program to find the largest number among the given numbers. Print the result as shown in the test cases.

title: Cannot find a file named places.sqlite
content:
I imported my bookmarks.json from another computer, via e.mail as I have always done for many years and used it to Restore my bookmarks.

As it has happened a few times before the restoring went apparently well and I can find my bookmarks in the Library (via Manage Bookmarks) but the toolbar is still showing the previous content evn after restarting Firefox.

As I have done in previous cases I looked up for the places.sqlite file but could find it.

Here is what I did find:

<startcode>

arthur-lifebooke743:[arthur]:~$ ls /home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox 

cajynx3c.default-release   installs.ini      'Pending Pings'    profiles.ini

'Crash Reports' mfe5h239.default 'Profile Groups' arthur-lifebooke743:[arthur]:~$ ls /home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox/Profile\ Groups 4d0dfc77.sqlite 4d0dfc77.sqlite-shm 4d0dfc77.sqlite-wal arthur-lifebooke743:[arthur]:~$ ls /home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox/mfe5h239.default/ times.json arthur-lifebooke743:[arthur]:~$ ls /home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox/cajynx3c.default-release/ addons.json key4.db addonStartup.json.lz4 lock AlternateServices.bin logins-backup.json bookmarkbackups logins.json bounce-tracking-protection.sqlite minidumps broadcast-listeners.json notificationstore.json cert9.db permissions.sqlite compatibility.ini pkcs11.txt containers.json places.sqlite content-prefs.sqlite places.sqlite-shm cookies.sqlite places.sqlite-wal cookies.sqlite-wal prefs.js crashes protections.sqlite datareporting search.json.mozlz4 domain_to_categories.sqlite security_state domain_to_categories.sqlite-journal serviceworker.txt extension-preferences.json sessionCheckpoints.json extensions sessionstore-backups extension-settings.json settings extensions.json shield-preference-experiments.json extension-store SiteSecurityServiceState.bin extension-store-menus storage favicons.sqlite storage.sqlite favicons.sqlite-shm storage-sync-v2.sqlite favicons.sqlite-wal times.json formhistory.sqlite webappsstore.sqlite gmp-gmpopenh264 webappsstore.sqlite-wal handlers.json xulstore.json arthur-lifebooke743:[arthur]:~$ ls /home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox/cajynx3c.default-release/

<endcode>

My question is: "Should I delete </home/arthur/.mozilla/firefox/cajynx3c.default-release/places.sqlite> since there is no such file in the <Profile Group> folder?

title: Primary password and password security on desktop
content:
Hi,

I’m wondering about how Firefox protects saved passwords, specifically the difference between using a primary password and not using one.

Without a primary password, are my saved passwords stored on my device in plain text, or in a way that could be easily accessed by malware or information-stealing viruses?

If I enable the primary password, does it encrypt my saved passwords or make them inaccessible to such programs?

I’m mainly curious whether using a primary password provides a real security benefit beyond needing it to autofill.

Thanks, Aidan

title: The settings gear for the sidebar is situated near the top instead of the bottom
content: I really enjoy the new sidebar revamp, but I've had an issue with it recently that I haven't been able to find a solution for. Typically, the settings gear is supposed to be situated near the bottom of bar. However, as demonstrated in the attached image, it is at the top near the bookmarks and history buttons. I have tried reinstalling the browser from scratch, turning the sidebar on and off, turning vertical tabs on and off, and even getting rid of my custom CSS theme for a time. None of these have worked. If anyone knows what the root of this issue is, I'd really appreciate the help.
creator: medievalpsx

title: Sorry, your browser does not support this feature. Please use a different browser and try again.
content: Facebook Games - I get this: "Sorry, your browser does not support this feature. Please use a different browser and try again. " What do I do? - 10/20/2025
creator: christine41036

title: Firefox on Zorin linux does not find file
content:
Setting my home page to file:///mnt/ACF8B287F8B24F78/html%20files/RFG%20Home%20Page%20(local).htm works just fine in the Brave browser. But Firefox returns a "File not found" error.

Any suggestions?
creator: rickg916
